department_name: Santa Clara County Department of Environmental Health

grading_system.description: Green-Yellow-Red color-coded placard system separate from numerical compliance scores. Placards based on major violations, scores based on all violations.

Green.description: PASS - No more than one major violation corrected during inspection

Yellow.description: CONDITIONAL PASS - Two or more major violations corrected during inspection

Red.description: CLOSURE - Imminent threat to health, violations not corrected

inspection_details.frequency: Typically twice per year for restaurants, varies by facility type and risk factors
inspection_details.reinspection_trigger: Yellow placard facilities may receive reinspection within 3 business days to ensure major violations remain corrected
inspection_details.public_disclosure: All inspection results, placards, and scores publicly available through SCCDineOut web application and posted placards at facilities

facility_safety_authority.department_name: Santa Clara County Fire Marshal's Office (operated by Santa Clara County Fire Department)
facility_safety_authority.ansul_system_requirements: Commercial kitchen hood and duct extinguishing system permits required with specific submittal and inspection requirements including bag/balloon tests and functional testing
facility_safety_authority.inspection_frequency: Multiple inspections required during installation - rough piping, functional testing, and final inspection

regulatory_framework.food_code_basis: California Retail Food Code, Health and Safety Code Division 104, Part 7
regulatory_framework.state_vs_local_authority: County-level inspections conducted by Santa Clara County Department of Environmental Health
regulatory_framework.local_ordinances: Restaurant placarding and scoring program launched October 2014, modeled after Sacramento County system

confidence_notes: Comprehensive official documentation found for grading system, inspection processes, and fire safety requirements. All information verified through official county sources.
verification_notes: System well-documented with clear explanations of hybrid placard/scoring methodology, violation categories with point deductions (Major: 8 points, Moderate: 3 points, Minor: 2 points), and fire safety inspection requirements for commercial kitchens.
